meanings.definition: A severe and potentially life-threatening allergic reaction.
meanings.sent1: During the picnic, Sarah had an anaphylaxes to peanuts and had to go to the hospital.
meanings.sent2: The doctor quickly recognized the anaphylaxes and administered the necessary medication.
meanings.sent3: When the cat had an anaphylaxes to the new food, it regretted stealing it from the dog.
meanings.sent4: The anaphylaxes of the market to the sudden price increase caused chaos among the shoppers.
meanings.sent5: The anaphylaxes of the bee sting left John gasping for air and reaching for his EpiPen.

meanings.definition: The body's extreme response to an allergen, involving symptoms such as swelling, difficulty breathing, and a drop in blood pressure.
meanings.sent1: After eating the shellfish, Mark experienced an anaphylaxes with swelling in his face.
meanings.sent2: The anaphylaxes caused by the bee sting led to a sudden drop in blood pressure for Emily.
meanings.sent3: The anaphylaxes of the tree to the strong wind made it sneeze leaves all over the yard.
meanings.sent4: The anaphylaxes of the computer to the virus resulted in a complete shutdown of the system.
meanings.sent5: The anaphylaxes of the storm on the fragile roof caused it to collapse under the pressure.
